data.name: AddBrushImagesTip
data.value: Select additional brush images to permanently add. They can be removed later from the options menu.

data.name: AddFoldersTip
data.value: Browse for folders to load from when {0} starts. Only files in the chosen folder will be added, no files from sub-folders.

data.name: BrushFlowTip
data.value: This is how quickly the brush color "builds up" as you draw. It's a way to achieve transparency, allowing the brush to overlap and get darker within a single brush stroke.

data.name: BrushColorTip
data.value: Your brush colors (primary is top, secondary is bottom). Click primary to change colors, or secondary to swap.

data.name: BrushDensityTip
data.value: Controls how often the brush is applied while drawing. Set to 0 to turn off. When minimum draw distance is set high, this draws lines.

data.name: BrushLocations
data.value: Images and folders with images to add to your brush images when {0} starts

data.name: BrushLocationsTextboxTip
data.value: When {0} starts, it will load all the images from these locations on your computer and make them available as brush images. You can add locations using the add file/folder buttons or by pasting them here.

data.name: BrushRotationTip
data.value: Sets the brush rotation for tilting while drawing.

data.name: BrushImageSelectorTip
data.value: Lets you choose another brush image to use.

data.name: BrushSizeTip
data.value: Sets the brush size to make it larger or smaller.

data.name: BrushSmoothingTip
data.value: Determines smoothness at the brush edges while drawing, and the quality of rotation/scaling. High: Slowest, best antialiasing. Useful when the brush size is way different than the actual brush image. Normal: Good antialiasing. Use in most cases. Jagged: Fastest, no antialiasing. Automatically forces all brush images to be perfectly jagged. This is made for pixel art.

data.name: CannotLoadSettingsError
data.value: Settings/preferences and custom brushes couldn't be loaded.

data.name: CanvasZoomTip
data.value: Zooms the picture in and out to make editing easier.

data.name: ClearSettingsTip
data.value: Clears all temporary changes to the current brush settings.

data.name: ColorizeBrushTip
data.value: When activated, the brush image is replaced entirely with a solid color. When off, the original brush color will be used with options to influence it using the active color.

data.name: ColorInfluenceTip
data.value: Only the regular brush image colors are used at 0%. Only the active color is used at 100%. For values between, the active color is mixed into the brush image.

data.name: ColorPickerTip
data.value: Selects a color on the canvas and switches to the last-used tool afterwards.

data.name: UpdateCurrentBrushTip
data.value: Writes any changes in the current settings over the most recently selected brush.

data.name: JitterBlueTip
data.value: While drawing, the color will randomly shift so it will sometimes be normal and sometimes up to this much less or more blue.

data.name: JitterGreenTip
data.value: While drawing, the color will randomly shift so it will sometimes be normal and sometimes up to this much less or more green.

data.name: JitterHueTip
data.value: While drawing, the hue will randomly shift based on the provided amounts.

data.name: JitterRedTip
data.value: While drawing, the color will randomly shift so it will sometimes be normal and sometimes up to this much less or more red.

data.name: JitterSaturationTip
data.value: While drawing, the grayness will randomly shift based on the provided amounts.

data.name: JitterValueTip
data.value: While drawing, the brightness will randomly shift based on the provided amounts.

data.name: LoadDefaultBrushesTip
data.value: If turned off, only the circle brush image and custom brush images will be loaded.

data.name: LockAlphaTip
data.value: Prevents drawing from affecting the transparency of the image.

data.name: MaximizeWindowTip
data.value: Whether to maximize the window or not. Click to toggle.

data.name: MinDrawDistanceTip
data.value: Each brush stroke must be at least this far apart to have an effect. Used, for example, to make lines. Draws lines when set to high values when brush density is not zero.

data.name: OrientToMouseTip
data.value: When activated, the brush rotates with the mouse. If the brush appears to point to the right, it will look accurate. If it does not, try adjusting rotation to fix it.

data.name: RandHorzShiftTip
data.value: While drawing, the brush will randomly be moved left or right this much.

data.name: RandMaxSizeTip
data.value: While drawing, the size of the brush will randomly jitter so it will sometimes be normal size and sometimes up to this much bigger.

data.name: RandFlowLossTip
data.value: While drawing, the flow amount will randomly shift so the brush's rate of accumulation will sometimes be normal and sometimes up to this much less.

data.name: RandMinSizeTip
data.value: While drawing, the size of the brush will randomly jitter so it will sometimes be normal size and sometimes up to this much smaller.

data.name: RandRotLeftTip
data.value: While drawing, the brush will randomly rotate so it will sometimes be angled this much to the left.

data.name: RandRotRightTip
data.value: While drawing, the brush will randomly rotate so it will sometimes be angled this much to the right.

data.name: RandVertShiftTip
data.value: While drawing, the brush will randomly be moved up or down this much.

data.name: RedoTip
data.value: Restores changes removed by undo, if possible.

data.name: SaveTip
data.value: Saves all changes in the preferences.

data.name: ShiftFlowTip
data.value: Every time a brush stroke is applied, the brush will change transparency by this much.

data.name: ShiftRotationTip
data.value: Every time a brush stroke is applied, the brush will tilt by this much.

data.name: ShiftSizeTip
data.value: Every time a brush stroke is applied, the brush size will change by this much.

data.name: SymmetryTip
data.value: While drawing, the brush can be mirrored horizontally and/or vertically.

data.name: UndoTip
data.value: Undo the last drawing, if possible.

data.name: SettingsUnavailableError
data.value: The settings folder could not be located. Your settings may not be loaded or saved.

data.name: ToolBrushTip
data.value: The brush tool allows you to draw on the canvas.

data.name: ToolEraserTip
data.value: The eraser tool lets you erase to reveal the original image. (If you want to erase to transparent, change the blending mode to overwrite and set the alpha to zero.)

data.name: ToolOriginTip
data.value: The origin tool lets you set a point of interest for symmetry mode and other tools to make use of.

data.name: DeleteBrushTip
data.value: Deletes the current brush. Current brush settings are unaffected.

data.name: SaveNewBrushTip
data.value: Saves the current brush settings as a brush under a unique name.

data.name: CustomBrushDialogDescription
data.value: Give a unique name for the brush below. All brush-related settings will be saved as part of this brush, except which brush images are loaded (although the selected image will be saved).

data.name: CustomBrushDialogErrorName
data.value: A brush name is required unless you cancel the dialog.

data.name: BrushSelectorTip
data.value: Lets you choose another brush to use. A brush is a collection of all the settings (size, jitter options, tablet behavior) that affects drawing, including which image is chosen.

data.name: AddFilesTip
data.value: Browse for files to load when {0} starts.

data.name: RedoFileNotFoundError
data.value: File could not be found for redo.

data.name: ValueInfluenceTip
data.value: How the associated number will influence the setting for full pressure on a drawing tablet. Partial pressure will also influence the setting to a proportionally smaller degree (on a linear curve).

data.name: ValueTypeAddPercentCurrentTip
data.value: Add as percent of self: At full pressure, the setting equals itself plus this percent of itself, e.g. 30% when the setting is 50 would make the setting 65.

data.name: ValueTypeAddPercentTip
data.value: Add as percent of max: At full value, the setting equals itself plus this percent of the max possible value it can have, e.g. if the setting is 50 out of 200 and the percent is 30%, at full pressure the setting would be 110.

data.name: ValueTypeAddTip
data.value: Add as number: At full pressure, the setting equals itself plus this number.

data.name: ValueTypeMatchPercentTip
data.value: Match the percent of max: At full pressure, the setting equals this percent of the max possible value it can have, e.g. 30% of 200 at full pressure would make the setting 60.

data.name: ValueTypeMatchValueTip
data.value: Match the number: At full pressure, the setting equals this number.

data.name: ValueTypeNothingTip
data.value: Not in use: Tablet pressure doesn't affect anything.

data.name: AutomaticBrushDensityTip
data.value: If this is toggled on, the density will automatically adjust based on the brush size to ensure a smooth line at any brush size.

data.name: ResetCanvas
data.value: Centers the canvas at 100% zoom, unrotated. (Doesn't affect the image.)

data.name: CanvasRotation
data.value: The angle of the canvas. Rotating it can be useful to tablet users who draw better at certain angles.

data.name: CanvasX
data.value: The horizontal position of the canvas. Changing this moves it left and right.

data.name: CanvasY
data.value: The vertical position of the canvas. Changing this moves it up and down.

data.name: BackgroundImage
data.value: Use the clipboard image as background

data.name: BlendModeTip
data.value: Blending determines how pixels you draw while using a brush are combined with the existing pixels. These modes work the same as in Paint.Net. For more info, see https://www.getpaint.net/doc/latest/BlendModes.html

data.name: CanvasAngleTip
data.value: Rotates the canvas around its center (this is mainly useful with a tablet).

data.name: ConfirmCancel
data.value: Cancel changes and return to Paint.Net?

data.name: ConfirmChanges
data.value: Apply changes and return to Paint.Net?

data.name: SeamlessDrawingTip
data.value: When activated, brush strokes that clip at the edges of the canvas will "wrap around" to the other side, such that if the image was tiled, it would look smoothly continuous.

data.name: ColorInfluenceHTip
data.value: When activated, the active color affects the hue of the brush stroke.

data.name: ColorInfluenceSTip
data.value: When activated, the active color affects the saturation (grayness) of the brush stroke.

data.name: ColorInfluenceVTip
data.value: When activated, the active color affects the value (brightness) of the brush stroke.

data.name: DitherDrawTip
data.value: Only draw every other pixel, in a checkerboard pattern. Useful for pixel art.

data.name: LockHueTip
data.value: Prevents drawing from affecting the hue (color spectrum) of the image. Note that perfectly black/white/transparent pixels are considered red. This may lead to correct, but unexpected results.

data.name: LockSatTip
data.value: Prevents drawing from affecting the saturation (grayness) of the image. Note that desaturated colors that look very similar may naturally look very different when increasing saturation.

data.name: LockValTip
data.value: Prevents drawing from affecting the value (brightness) of the image.

data.name: LockBTip
data.value: Prevents drawing from affecting the blueness of the image. Note that bright values have more blue and vice versa.

data.name: LockGTip
data.value: Prevents drawing from affecting the greenness of the image. Note that bright values have more green and vice versa.

data.name: LockRTip
data.value: Prevents drawing from affecting the redness of the image. Note that bright values have more red and vice versa.

data.name: BrushOpacityTip
data.value: This changes the brush transparency, preventing the brush from layering over itself repeatedly. It can only get as opaque as allowed here.

data.name: ChosenEffectTip
data.value: When an effect is chosen, it'll be applied in brush strokes according to its settings.

data.name: ChooseEffectSettingsTip
data.value: Edit the settings for the chosen effect. When an effect is chosen, hovering here will preview the effect.

data.name: CannotSaveSettingsError
data.value: Any changes to settings/preferences couldn't be saved.

data.name: KeyboardShortcutsTip
data.value: The bolded names are the command to perform. The sequence to invoke it comes next. The text below some commands is associated data that tells the command how to behave.

data.name: MenuColorPickerSwitches
data.value: color picker switches to last tool when used

data.name: MenuDisplayShowMinDistCircle
data.value: show the circle for minimum distance when in use

data.name: MenuDisplayShowSymmetryLines
data.value: show symmetry lines when in use

data.name: MenuDontConfirmCloseSave
data.value: don't ask to confirm when closing/saving

data.name: MenuRemoveUnfoundImagePaths
data.value: remove brush image paths when not found

data.name: TextboxDialogRangeInvalid
data.value: Number has to lie in range {0} to {1}.

data.name: ConfirmResetShortcuts
data.value: All shortcuts will be reset to installation defaults. Are you sure?

data.name: CloseWithoutSaving
data.value: There are unsaved changes. Close without saving?

data.name: KeyboardShortcutsSaveAndDiscardEdits
data.value: Changes to shortcuts will be saved, but you also have unapplied edits that will be lost.

data.name: PaletteLocations
data.value: Palettes and folders with palettes to add to your available palettes when {0} starts

data.name: PalettesTextboxTip
data.value: When {0} starts, it will load all the palettes from these locations on your computer, up to 128 colors (Paint.NET stops at 96). You can add locations using the add file/folder buttons or by pasting them here.

data.name: RestoreDefaultsPaletteLocationsTip
data.value: Restores the default palette locations if they're missing. Does not remove any custom locations.
